text: {p}Sunday will be a lot calmer than Saturday with some nice sunbreaks for the morning and most of the afternoon. Showers will start moving back after sunset. Highs today will hit the mid to upper 50s.{/p}{p}Showers will take over tonight making for a wet start to your Monday morning. Lows should drop to the upper 40s in most spots.{/p}{p}Monday will have frequent showers and the chance of a thundershower or two. The best chance to hear the rumble of thunder will be along the ocean beaches, areas south of Tacoma, and in the Puget Sound Convergence Zone of north King and south Snohomish Counties. Highs on Monday will make it to the mid to upper 50s once again.{/p}{p}Rain will continue on Tuesday under gray skies. Highs should drop back to a bit to the mid-50s.{/p}{p}Right now the forecast models say Wednesday should bring mostly dry weather with some sunbreaks. It will not be all that warm with daytime highs only getting to the low to mid-50s.{/p}{p}Theron Zahn{br}The KOMO 4-Cast Team{br}{/p}{p}{strong}Updated Sunday Morning{/strong}{/p}{p}Mia Schem, a 21-year-old Israeli-French tattoo artist, is likening her time in Hamas captivity to the Holocaust.{br}{/p}{p}In October, Schem was featured in a Hamas video receiving medical attention for a wound on her arm while laying in a bed. She then speaks to the camera as a loud boom is heard in the background.{/p}{p}“They are taking care of me, giving me medicine, everything is fine,” Schem {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/hamas-terrorists-release-video-of-abducted-french-woman-get-us-out-of-here-as-quickly-as-possible-palestine-israel-war-fighting-middle-east-hostage-\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/hamas-terrorists-release-video-of-abducted-french-woman-get-us-out-of-here-as-quickly-as-possible-palestine-israel-war-fighting-middle-east-hostage-\"}said {/a}in Hebrew. “I only ask that they bring me home as soon as possible to my parents, to my siblings. Please get us out of here as quickly as possible.”{/p}{p}Schem was recently released as part of a temporary ceasefire between Israel and Hamas. In a new {a href=\"https://twitter.com/IMTIzionism/status/1740424632606589343\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://twitter.com/IMTIzionism/status/1740424632606589343\"}interview{/a}, she speaks candidly about the maltreatment of individuals captured by Hamas.{/p}{p}“It was important to me to reflect the real situation on the people who live in Gaza,” Schem said in a preview clip released by Israel's Channel 12 News Thursday.{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{ }{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/lady-in-red-photographed-fleeing-oct-7-hamas-attacks-feels-guilty-over-survival-report-says-vlada-patapov-israel-nova-music-festival-terrorists-terrorism-gaza-palestine-middle-east-conflict#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/lady-in-red-photographed-fleeing-oct-7-hamas-attacks-feels-guilty-over-survival-report-says-vlada-patapov-israel-nova-music-festival-terrorists-terrorism-gaza-palestine-middle-east-conflict#\"}'Lady in red' photographed fleeing Oct. 7 Hamas attacks feels guilty over survival, report says{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}When asked what the “important thing” she wants people to understand is, Schem said her treatment by Hamas was historically evil.{/p}{blockquote}“I went through the Holocaust,” she said. “Everyone there is a terrorist.\"{/blockquote}{p}She went on to describe the conditions in the Hamas camps as scary and strict.{/p}{p}“I was closed in the room, it's dark.
